intro: Cyrtandra rhizantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Cyrtandra rhizantha has a rhizomatous root system, which helps it spread and establish in its native environment. It plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the region's biodiversity.
